p: According to the PRISMA checklist, qualitative data were extracted in two steps ( Moher et al., 2009). Firstly, publication details (author's name, year and country of publication, name of epidemic, study aim, methodology, sample characteristics, study design, and data collection and analysis) and findings were extracted. Secondly, both verbatim and non-verbatim statements about the experiences, needs, and/or perceptions of pregnant women, midwives, and nurses who lived through the epidemics and/or the pandemics were extracted for a subsequent thematic analysis within and across all included studies. Any discrepancies that arose were discussed between the reviewers until a consensus was reached.
